SEARCH
Package utilities

Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
utilities.XMLParser
public class XMLParser extends Object
A simple XML parser to validate the structure of an XML document. It uses custom stack and queue implementations to check for tag mismatches and report errors.

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      public void readFile(String fileName)
      Reads an XML file line by line and validates its structure.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path to the XML file.

    • validateXML

      private void validateXML(String line)
      Validates a single line of XML.
      Parameters:
      line - The XML line to validate.

    • isProcessingInstruction

      private boolean isProcessingInstruction(String part)
      Checks if a string is a processing instruction (e.g., invalid input: '<'?xml version="1.0"?>).
      Parameters:
      part - The string to check.
      Returns:
      True if it is a processing instruction, false otherwise.

    • printErrors

      public void printErrors()
      Prints the results of the XML validation. If there are errors, they are printed in the order they occurred. If no errors are found, a success message is displayed.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method to run the XMLParser from the command line.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments. The first argument should be the XML file path.
